CatDescriptText: Portions of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, August 1, 1942, pg. 9, read: "...was the second to pledge her troth, Saturday [?] in Church of the Holy Cross before the Bishop [?] of Cleveland with the handsome Robert Lavelle, son of Mrs. Mary and the late Rev. Lavelle. Adah, the daughter of Jack Crosby Moore and the late Elsie Cap[?], is another doll-like beauty with large grey-blue eyes and blonde hair...Her maid of honor was the beautiful Rosalind Lindsay...bridesmaids were the chairming [sic] and lovely Romaine Denning, Geraldine Burgia, Euzzy Mahoney and Norma Branch...Miss Iris Scott, daughter of the Herman Scotts of New Haven, Conn., was flower girl... Little [?] Goode, son of the Malvin Goodes, in a white Fauntleroy, was the ring-bearer...best man Ramond Mahoney.  His grooms men were: his brother, Frank Lavelle, Malvin Goode, [?] Olmstead, Wellington Young...reception at the family house on Chalfont Street..."
TitMainTitle: Bridesmaid, and bride Adah Moore Lavelle wearing gown with faintly striped yoke, small buttons on front, and long sleeves with puffed shoulders, posed in yard possibly on Chalfont Street, at night
